meanings.definition: Forbid or prohibit by law or decree.
meanings.sent1: The sign clearly proscribes parking in this area.
meanings.sent2: The school's rules proscribes students from using their phones during class.
meanings.sent3: The teacher jokingly proscribes eating in the library to avoid any mess.
meanings.sent4: The ancient law proscribes the use of certain herbs for medicinal purposes.
meanings.sent5: The warning label proscribes the consumption of this product for safety reasons.

meanings.definition: Denounce or condemn as dangerous or harmful.
meanings.sent1: The doctor proscribes smoking for patients' well-being.
meanings.sent2: The environmentalist proscribes the use of plastic to protect the oceans.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully proscribes eating too many sweets to maintain a healthy diet.
meanings.sent4: The wise elder proscribes gossiping to prevent conflicts in the community.
meanings.sent5: The safety manual proscribes shortcuts to ensure workplace safety.
